feed.title: Combined summary - HEADS UP: Bitcoin 0.9.0 doesn't work on old Linux

entry.title: Combined summary - HEADS UP: Bitcoin 0.9.0 doesn't work on old Linux
entry.summary: In 2014, a user named Jesus Cea encountered an issue after upgrading to Bitcoin 0.9.0 on Red Hat Enterprise Linux. When trying to run the bitcoind and bitcoin-qt commands, an error message appeared stating that versions GLIBC_2.15 and GLIBC_2.14 were required but not found in the system's /lib/libc.so.6 directory. This issue was later confirmed as a known problem and can be found on Github under issue number 3803.The response from Wladimir did not provide a solution to the problem. Contact information for Jesús Cea Avión is included in the email signature, along with a quote from Leibniz about love. The email also includes a digital signature attachment.
